snippet: The transitional body is intended to unify the West Bank and Gaza, but it could also complicate relations with Israel.
abstract: Palestinian Authority Pres Mahmoud Abbas swears in new government intended to reunite West Bank and Gaza Strip after seven years of political and social division; ceremony comes six weeks after Palestine Liberation Organization and militant Hamas movement signed pact paving way for the new government.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Ramallah, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Said Ghazali contributed reporting from Ramallah, and Fares Akram from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: The transitional body is intended to unify the West Bank and Gaza, but it could also complicate relations with Israel.

headline.main: With Hope for Unity, Abbas Swears In a New Palestinian Government
headline.print_headline: With Hope for Unity, Abbas Swears In a New Palestinian Government
